text: what makes Cisco unique is we are the
world's largest food service distributor
we're probably the only global food
service distributor that's working
across many countries and many
continents we are a very high volume low
margin business so time is literally
money we can't afford to have issues and
challenges with technology we have got
to keep product moving our IT
environment before we move to the cloud
was probably similar to a lot of other
big companies we've had a heavily
outsourced to organization from an IT
perspective we also had a number of
legacy applications that have been
running for years and years and years
from a technology standpoint our biggest
challenge has always been always on
always available our ability to scale
globally was very important and at the
end of the day I think the biggest thing
was our ability to innovate and find a
partner that was innovative with us and
AWS was clearly the most in it when
we're evaluating options on going to the
cloud we looked at all the major players
and for me it wasn't just about the
technology offering they had today the
more important part was the pace of
innovation and the ecosystem and those
are two areas where Amazon Web Services
came out on top quite frankly one of the
things we actually focus on is business
capability components or services from
from AWS that starts from a foundational
level of storage when we think about how
we're using s3 as our data Lake our main
storage repository we're using glacier
for archival we valued a number of
things with s3 obviously there's a
durability the scalability
all those the all the illa DS as you
would say but quite frankly the thing I
like the most is it's our main data Lake
now so that's where we store all of our
raw data and that allows us to do a lot
of transformations data loads extracts
right from there we can even query the
data straight on s3 which is great as
well
also since s3 is so capable and there's
a lot of API is just around accessing
data manipulating data querying data on
s3 we're able to use that instead of
building our own tools or using some of
these bolt ons that you have with other
environments as you can imagine if
you're thinking about a data centric
application we have a lot of flexibility
in accessing the data querying the data
and managing the data in s3 that before
we either had to use custom tools for or
find some other bolt-ons some of the key
benefits of moving to AWS have been our
ability to take advantage of tools like
glacier in fact one of our big workloads
we were able to reduce our storage cost
by over 40% by starting to really
rethink the way we store what we call
hot storage and our cold storage
internal concerns around moving to the
cloud with a typical you know what about
security
is my data gonna be safe there we just
kind of factually went through those
issues with folks and the fact of the
matter is our data is more secure in the
AWS cloud than it is in some of our own
data centers AWS makes a tremendous
investment in security that you can
leverage across their entire environment
and probably an investment that we can't
make ourselves and once people got
comfortable with that and once people
understood all of the tools and the
securities that AWS had we were able to
move along but we just did it in a
fact-based way using AWS using tools
like glacier we're able to archive data
that isn't being used but
like many companies we had a very siloed
data and analytics structure and we
really used AWS as a way to bring this
all together so we now have taken all of
our data harmonized it put it together
into one data Lake in AWS surrounded by
all of the ecosystem of analytic and AI
and big data tools that are available in
the AWS ecosystem we're just beginning
to leverage the benefits of it but it's
been it's been a very big win for us
we have moved probably 50% of our
workloads out of our data centers into
AWS our ability to spin up servers in
minutes as opposed to hours and weeks
and months has allowed us to move with
speed that the business needs as a chief
technology officer AWS does make your
job easier we're sort of out of the
hosting business and we're using our
energy and our time and our focus now to
create business applications that are
going to help us win with our customers
and win in the marketplace and that is a
great trade-off
